tit.cmt: 他の同様の町と同じく、cho として表記しました。

sen.j: 三和町（みわちょう）は、かつて京都府天田郡におかれていた町。
sen.e: Miwa was a town located in Amata-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Miwa was a town located in Amata-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Miwa-cho was a town located in Amata-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 他の同様の町と同じく、cho として表記しました。

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）1月1日に福知山市、天田郡夜久野町、加佐郡大江町 (京都府)と合併し消滅、町域は「福知山市三和町」となった。
sen.e: On January 1, 2006, Miwa town was dissolved as a result of the merger with Fukuchiyama City, Yakuno town from Amata-gun and Oe town from Kasa-gun (Kyoto Prefecture), and its town area was named 'Miwa-cho, Fukuchiyama City.'

On January 1, 2006, Miwa town was dissolved as a result of the merger with Fukuchiyama City, Yakuno town from Amata-gun and Oe town from Kasa-gun (Kyoto Prefecture), and its town area was named 'Miwa-cho, Fukuchiyama City.'

On January 1, 2006, Miwa-cho was dissolved as a result of the merger with Fukuchiyama City, Yakuno-cho from Amata-gun and Oe-cho from Kasa-gun (Kyoto Prefecture), and its town area was named 'Miwa-cho, Fukuchiyama City.'
sen.cmt: 他の同様の町と同じく、cho として表記しました。

sen.j: 合併方式は福知山市への編入。
sen.e: Miwa town was merged in the form of being incorporated into Fukuchiyama City.
Miwa town was merged in the form of being incorporated into Fukuchiyama City.
Miwa-cho was merged in the form of being incorporated into Fukuchiyama City.
sen.cmt: 他の同様の町と同じく、cho として表記しました。

sen.j: 町の標語は「いのち ふれあい あすひらくまち――みわ」。
sen.e: The town slogan is 'Miwa, town where people bond each other, and which opens the door to the future.'
The town slogan is 'Miwa, town where people bond each other, and which opens the door to the future.'
The town slogan is 'Miwa, town where people bond each other, and which opens the door to the future.'

sen.j: 町の特産品は、栗、松茸、椎茸、ブドウ、小豆。
sen.e: Specialty products of the town are chestnuts, matsutake mushrooms, shiitake mushrooms, grapes and adzuki beans.
Specialty products of the town are chestnuts, matsutake mushrooms, shiitake mushrooms, grapes and adzuki beans.
Specialty products of the town are chestnuts, matsutake mushrooms, shiitake mushrooms, grapes and adzuki beans.

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1955年（昭和30年）3月31日 天田郡菟原村、細見村、川合村が合併して三和村誕生
sen.e: On March 31, 1955, Miwa village was formed as a result of the merger of the villages of Ubara, Hosomi and Kawai from Amata-gun.
sen.cmt: 天田郡菟原村、細見村、川合村→the villages of Ubara, Hosomi and Kawai from Amata-gun[3つの村すべてが船井郡に位置しています。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/北桑田郡の英語版内の表記に合わせました。]
sen.e: On March 31, 1955, Miwa village was formed as a result of the merger of the villages of Ubara, Hosomi and Kawai from Amata-gun.
March 31, 1955: Miwa-mura was formed as a result of the merger of the villages of Ubara-mura, Hosomi-mura and Kawai-mura of Amata-gun.
sen.cmt: mura を追加しました。「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 1956年（昭和31年） 4月1日 町制施行
sen.e: On April 1, 1956, the town organization was enforced.
On April 1, 1956, the town organization was enforced.
April 1, 1956: The town organization was enforced.

sen.j: 町長：田中敬夫（たなかたかお）（2003年4月～）4期目
sen.e: Town mayor: Takao TANAKA (since April 2003) in the 4th term
Town mayor: Takao TANAKA (since April 2003) in the 4th term
Town mayor: Takao TANAKA (since April 2003) in the fourth term
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 鉄道路線
sen.e: Railway lines
Railway lines
Railroads
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 三和町内には鉄道路線がないが、三和町営バスが西日本旅客鉄道山陰本線 綾部駅と、JRバスが福知山駅と三和町とを結んでいる
sen.e: In the town of Miwa, there are no railway lines, but the town of Miwa is connected to Ayabe Station on the Sanin Main Line of West Japan Rail Way Company (JR West) by Miwa Town Bus, and to Fukuchiyama Station by JR Bus.

In the town of Miwa, there are no railway lines, but the town of Miwa is connected to Ayabe Station on the Sanin Main Line of West Japan Rail Way Company (JR West) by Miwa Town Bus, and to Fukuchiyama Station by JR Bus.

Within Miwa-cho, there are no railway lines, but Miwa-cho is connected to Ayabe Station on the Sanin Main Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) by Miwa Town Bus, and to Fukuchiyama Station by JR Bus.
